moduleInfo.moduleTitle: Advanced Theory and Practices/03 PR Shaping your Narrative/Understanding PR Fundamentals

overview.quote: Your reputation is fundamentally the most important part of your career.
overview.introText: PR isn't just for celebrities. As your online presence grows, understanding the basics of public relations becomes essential to maintain trust and build a positive reputation in the digital space.

keyTerms.definition: Understanding yourself, who you're trying to be, and where you're trying to get to in the public eye.
Actively shaping how others perceive you through consistent messaging and authentic engagement.
The unique combination of skills, experience, and personality you want the world to see.
The brief time (often just minutes) viewers have to form an opinion about you and your content.

actionPlan: Write down your core values and principles
Audit your existing content for consistency
Create a simple PR response plan
Practice articulating your story in 60 seconds

mainContent.title: The Viewer's Tiny Window
mainContent.text: Most people will only see you for minutes per day, maximum. The internet judges quickly and rarely cares about context. Make every second count.

summaryPoints: Nuanced opinions rarely fit in short content

mainContent.title: Think Long-Term
mainContent.text: Don't just consider how your content lands today. Think about your future goals and how today's posts will be perceived as your audience and platform grow.

summaryPoints: Growth exposes content to wider scrutiny

mainContent.title: Who You Really Are
mainContent.text: PR starts with self-awareness. Understanding your authentic self and values creates a foundation for genuine connection that audiences can feel.

proTips.text: Write your PR principles when you're NOT in crisis. It's like creating a fire escape plan before there's smoke.
The 'pigeonhole test': If viewers had to describe you in three words, what would they be? Are those the right words?

finalWords.emphasis: Your reputation is built in drops but lost in buckets.
finalWords.description: A single misstep can undo months of careful reputation building.
